intro: Afropectinariella pungens, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant has smooth, succulent leaves and produces a milky sap that can be irritant. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. Afropectinariella pungens is adapted to withstand drought conditions due to its succulent nature.
